section.title: Executive Summary
section.instruction:
Provide a high-level overview of key findings, market opportunity assessment, and strategic recommendations. Write this section LAST after completing all other sections.
Synthesize key findings from all sections into a concise executive summary

section.title: Research Objectives & Methodology
section.instruction: This template guides the creation of a comprehensive market research report. Begin by understanding what market insights the user needs and why. Work through each section systematically, using the appropriate analytical frameworks based on the research objectives.

section.title: Research Objectives
section.instruction: List the primary objectives of this market research: - What decisions will this research inform? - What specific questions need to be answered? - What are the success criteria for this research?

section.title: Research Methodology
section.instruction: Describe the research approach: - Data sources used (primary/secondary) - Analysis frameworks applied - Data collection timeframe - Limitations and assumptions

section.title: Market Overview
section.instruction: Provide comprehensive market analysis including definition, size, and trends.

section.title: Market Definition
section.instruction: Define the market being analyzed: - Product/service category - Geographic scope - Customer segments included - Value chain position

section.title: Market Size & Growth
section.instruction: Guide through TAM, SAM, SOM calculations with clear assumptions. Use one or more approaches: - Top-down: Start with industry data, narrow down - Bottom-up: Build from customer/unit economics - Value theory: Based on value provided vs. alternatives

section.title: Total Addressable Market (TAM)
section.instruction:
Calculate and explain the total market opportunity.
Provide TAM calculation with clear methodology and assumptions

section.title: Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM)
section.instruction:
Define the portion of TAM you can realistically reach.
Calculate SAM based on geographic, regulatory, or technical constraints

section.title: Serviceable Obtainable Market (SOM)
section.instruction:
Estimate the portion you can realistically capture.
Calculate SOM based on competitive position and market share assumptions

section.title: Market Trends & Drivers
section.instruction: Analyze key trends shaping the market using appropriate frameworks like PESTEL.

section.title: Key Market Trends
section.instruction: List and explain 3-5 major trends: - Trend 1: Description and impact - Trend 2: Description and impact - etc.

section.title: Growth Drivers
section.instruction: Identify primary factors driving market growth.

section.title: Market Inhibitors
section.instruction: Identify factors constraining market growth.

section.title: Customer Analysis
section.instruction:
Provide detailed customer segment analysis and jobs-to-be-done framework.
Develop comprehensive customer understanding based on available data

section.title: Target Segment Profiles
section.instruction:
For each segment, create detailed profiles:
**Segment [Number]: [Name]** - **Description:** Brief overview - **Size:** Number of customers/market value - **Characteristics:** Key demographics/firmographics - **Needs & Pain Points:** Primary problems - **Buying Process:** Purchasing decisions - **Willingness to Pay:** Price sensitivity

section.title: Jobs-to-be-Done Analysis
section.instruction: Uncover what customers are really trying to accomplish.

section.title: Functional Jobs
section.instruction: List practical tasks and objectives customers need to complete.

section.title: Emotional Jobs
section.instruction: Describe feelings and perceptions customers seek.

section.title: Social Jobs
section.instruction: Explain how customers want to be perceived by others.

section.title: Customer Journey Mapping
section.instruction:
Map the end-to-end customer experience for primary segments:
1. **Awareness:** How customers discover solutions 2. **Consideration:** Evaluation criteria 3. **Purchase:** Decision triggers 4. **Onboarding:** Initial expectations 5. **Usage:** Interaction patterns 6. **Advocacy:** Referral behaviors

section.title: Competitive Landscape
section.instruction:
Analyze the competitive environment and positioning.
Provide competitive analysis based on available market data

section.title: Market Structure
section.instruction: Describe the overall competitive environment: - Number of competitors - Market concentration - Competitive intensity

section.title: Major Players Analysis
section.instruction: For top 3-5 competitors: - Company name and brief description - Market share estimate - Key strengths and weaknesses - Target customer focus - Pricing strategy

section.title: Competitive Positioning
section.instruction: Analyze how competitors are positioned: - Value propositions - Differentiation strategies - Market gaps and opportunities

section.title: Industry Analysis
section.instruction:
Provide industry-level analysis using established frameworks.
Apply Porter's Five Forces and adoption lifecycle analysis

section.title: Porter's Five Forces Assessment
section.instruction: Analyze each force with specific evidence and implications.

section.title: Supplier Power
section.instruction:
**Power Level:** [Low/Medium/High]
Analysis and implications for the market.

section.title: Buyer Power
section.instruction:
**Power Level:** [Low/Medium/High]
Analysis and implications for the market.

section.title: Competitive Rivalry
section.instruction:
**Intensity Level:** [Low/Medium/High]
Analysis and implications for the market.

section.title: Threat of New Entry
section.instruction:
**Threat Level:** [Low/Medium/High]
Analysis and implications for the market.

section.title: Threat of Substitutes
section.instruction:
**Threat Level:** [Low/Medium/High]
Analysis and implications for the market.

section.title: Technology Adoption Lifecycle Stage
section.instruction: Identify where the market is in the adoption curve: - Current stage and evidence - Implications for strategy - Expected progression timeline

section.title: Opportunity Assessment
section.instruction:
Identify and assess specific market opportunities based on the analysis.
Synthesize insights to identify actionable opportunities

section.title: Market Opportunities
section.instruction: **Opportunity [Number]: [Name]** - **Description:** What is the opportunity - **Size/Potential:** Quantified potential - **Requirements:** What's needed to capture - **Risks:** Key challenges

section.title: Strategic Recommendations
section.instruction: Provide strategic recommendations based on market analysis.

section.title: Go-to-Market Strategy
section.instruction: Recommend approach for market entry/expansion: - Target segment prioritization - Positioning strategy - Channel strategy - Partnership opportunities

section.title: Pricing Strategy
section.instruction: Based on willingness to pay analysis and competitive landscape: - Recommended pricing model - Price points/ranges - Value metric - Competitive positioning

section.title: Risk Mitigation
section.instruction: Key risks and mitigation strategies: - Market risks - Competitive risks - Execution risks - Regulatory/compliance risks

section.title: Appendices
section.instruction: Include supporting information and detailed analysis.

section.title: A. Data Sources
section.instruction: List all sources used in the research.

section.title: B. Detailed Calculations
section.instruction: Include any complex calculations or models.

section.title: C. Additional Analysis
section.instruction: Any supplementary analysis not included in main body.
